outputSchema.title: Subscriber Lists
outputSchema.description: A collection of subscriber lists for this account. Lists contain subscribers who have opted-in to receive correspondence from you or your organization.

items.title: Subscriber List
items.description: Information about a specific list.

id.title: List ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this list.

web_id.title: List Web ID
web_id.description: The ID used in the MailChimp web application. View this list in your MailChimp account at `https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/lists/members/?id={web_id}`.

contact.title: List Contact
contact.description: [Contact information displayed in campaign footers](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/about-the-required-email-footer-content?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to comply with international spam laws.

company.title: Company Name
company.description: The company name for the list.

address1.title: Address
address1.description: The street address for the list contact.

address2.title: Address
address2.description: The street address for the list contact.

city.title: City
city.description: The city for the list contact.

state.title: State
state.description: The state for the list contact.

zip.title: Postal Code
zip.description: The postal or zip code for the list contact.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: A two-character ISO3166 country code. Defaults to US if invalid.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the list contact.

use_archive_bar.title: Use Archive Bar
use_archive_bar.description: Whether campaigns for this list use the [Archive Bar](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/archives/about-the-archive-bar?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in archives by default.

campaign_defaults.title: Campaign Defaults
campaign_defaults.description: [Default values for campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/set-up-email-subject-from-name-and-from-email-address-on-a-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) created for this list.

from_name.title: Sender's Name
from_name.description: The default from name for campaigns sent to this list.

from_email.title: Sender's Email Address
from_email.description: The default from email for campaigns sent to this list.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: The default subject line for campaigns sent to this list.

language.title: Language
language.description: The default language for this lists's forms.

notify_on_subscribe.title: Notify on Subscribe
notify_on_subscribe.description: The email address to send [subscribe notifications](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/change-subscribe-and-unsubscribe-notifications?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to.

notify_on_unsubscribe.title: Notify on Unsubscribe
notify_on_unsubscribe.description: The email address to send [unsubscribe notifications](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/change-subscribe-and-unsubscribe-notifications?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to.

date_created.title: Creation Date
date_created.description: The date and time that this list was created.

list_rating.title: List Rating
list_rating.description: An auto-generated activity score for the list (0-5).

email_type_option.title: Email Type Option
email_type_option.description: Whether the list supports [multiple formats for emails](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/how-to-change-list-name-and-defaults?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Change-Subscription-Settings). When set to `true`, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails. When set to `false`, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup.

subscribe_url_short.title: Subscribe URL Short
subscribe_url_short.description: Our [EepURL shortened](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/signup-forms/share-your-signup-form?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Signup-Form-URL) version of this list's subscribe form.

subscribe_url_long.title: Subscribe URL Long
subscribe_url_long.description: The full version of this list's subscribe form (host will vary).

visibility.title: Visibility
visibility.description: Whether this list is [public or private](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/about-publicity-settings?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

modules.title: Modules
modules.description: Any list-specific modules installed for this list.

stats.title: Statistics
stats.description: Stats for the list. Many of these are cached for at least five minutes.

member_count.title: Member Count
member_count.description: The number of active members in the list.

unsubscribe_count.title: Unsubscribe Count
unsubscribe_count.description: The number of members who have unsubscribed from the list.

cleaned_count.title: Cleaned Count
cleaned_count.description: The number of members cleaned from the list.

member_count_since_send.title: Member Count Since Send
member_count_since_send.description: The number of active members in the list since the last campaign was sent.

unsubscribe_count_since_send.title: Unsubscribe Count Since Send
unsubscribe_count_since_send.description: The number of members who have unsubscribed since the last campaign was sent.

cleaned_count_since_send.title: Cleaned Count Since Send
cleaned_count_since_send.description: The number of members cleaned from the list since the last campaign was sent.

campaign_count.title: Campaign Count
campaign_count.description: The number of campaigns in any status that use this list.

campaign_last_sent.title: Campaign Last Sent
campaign_last_sent.description: The date and time the last campaign was sent to this list. This is updated when a campaign is sent to 10 or more recipients.

merge_field_count.title: Merge Var Count
merge_field_count.description: The number of merge vars for this list (not EMAIL, which is required).

avg_sub_rate.title: Average Subscription Rate
avg_sub_rate.description: The average number of subscriptions per month for the list (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

avg_unsub_rate.title: Average Unsubscription Rate
avg_unsub_rate.description: The average number of unsubscriptions per month for the list (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

target_sub_rate.title: Average Subscription Rate
target_sub_rate.description: The target number of subscriptions per month for the list to keep it growing (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The average open rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The average click rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

last_sub_date.title: Date of Last List Subscribe
last_sub_date.description: The date and time of the last time someone subscribed to this list.

last_unsub_date.title: Date of Last List Unsubscribe
last_unsub_date.description: The date and time of the last time someone unsubscribed from this list.

actions.title: getListsIdMembers
actions.description: Get information about members in a specific MailChimp list.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

count.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **10**.

offset.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **0**.

list_id.description: The unique id for the list.

since_timestamp_opt.description: Restrict results to subscribers who opted-in after the set timeframe. We recommend [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

before_timestamp_opt.description: Restrict results to subscribers who opted-in before the set timeframe. We recommend [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

since_last_changed.description: Restrict results to subscribers whose information changed after the set timeframe.

before_last_changed.description: Restrict results to subscribers whose information changed before the set timeframe.

unique_email_id.description: A unique identifier for the email address across all MailChimp lists. This parameter can be found in any links with [Ecommerce Tracking](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/e-commerce/how-to-use-mailchimp-for-e-commerce?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) enabled.

vip_only.description: A filter to return only the list's VIP members. Passing `true` will restrict results to VIP list members, passing `false` will return all list members.

interest_category_id.description: The unique id for the interest category.

interest_ids.description: Used to filter list members by interests. Must be accompanied by interest_category_id and interest_match. The value must be a comma separated list of interest ids present for the given interest category.

interest_match.description: Used to filter list members by interests. Must be accompanied by interest_category_id and interest_ids. "any" will match a member with any of the interest supplied, "all" will only match members with every interest supplied, and "none" will match members without any of the interest supplied.

dc.description: `dc` corresponds to the data center for your account. For example, if the last part of your MailChimp API key is us6, set `dc` to `"us6"`

actions.title: getReports
actions.description: Get campaign reports.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

count.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **10**.

offset.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **0**.

type.description: The campaign type.

before_send_time.description: Restrict the response to campaigns sent before the set time. We recommend [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

since_send_time.description: Restrict the response to campaigns sent after the set time. We recommend [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

dc.description: `dc` corresponds to the data center for your account. For example, if the last part of your MailChimp API key is us6, set `dc` to `"us6"`

outputSchema.description: A list of reports containing campaigns marked as Sent.

items.title: Campaign Report
items.description: Report details about a sent campaign.

id.title: Campaign ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign.

type.title: Campaign Type
type.description: The type of campaign (regular, plain-text, ab_split, rss, automation, variate, or auto).

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique list id.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

abuse_reports.title: Abuse Reports
abuse_reports.description: The number of abuse reports generated for this campaign.

unsubscribed.title: Unsubscribe Count
unsubscribed.description: The total number of unsubscribed members for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent.

rss_last_send.title: RSS Last Send
rss_last_send.description: For RSS campaigns, the date and time of the last send

bounces.title: Bounces
bounces.description: An object describing the bounce summary for the campaign.

hard_bounces.title: Hard Bounces
hard_bounces.description: The total number of hard bounced email addresses.

soft_bounces.title: Soft Bounces
soft_bounces.description: The total number of soft bounced email addresses.

syntax_errors.title: Syntax Errors
syntax_errors.description: The total number of addresses that were syntax-related bounces.

forwards.title: Forwards
forwards.description: An object describing the forwards and forward activity for the campaign.

forwards_count.title: Total Forwards
forwards_count.description: How many times the campaign has been forwarded.

forwards_opens.title: Forward Opens
forwards_opens.description: How many times the forwarded campaign has been opened.

opens.description: An object describing the open activity for the campaign.

opens_total.title: Total Opens
opens_total.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

unique_opens.title: Unique Opens
unique_opens.description: The total number of unique opens.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The date and time of the last recorded open.

clicks.title: Clicks
clicks.description: An object describing the click activity for the campaign.

clicks_total.title: Total Clicks
clicks_total.description: The total number of clicks for the campaign.

unique_clicks.title: Unique Clicks
unique_clicks.description: The total number of unique clicks for links across a campaign.

unique_subscriber_clicks.title: Unique Subscriber Clicks
unique_subscriber_clicks.description: The total number of subscribers who clicked on a campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

last_click.title: Last Click
last_click.description: The date and time of the last recorded click for the campaign.

recipient_likes.title: Recipient Likes
recipient_likes.description: The number of recipients who liked the campaign on Facebook.

facebook_likes.title: Facebook Likes

actions.title: getEcommerceOrders
actions.description: Get information about an account's orders.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

count.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **10**.

offset.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **0**.

campaign_id.description: Restrict results to orders with a specific `campaign_id` value.

outreach_id.description: Restrict results to orders with a specific `outreach_id` value.

customer_id.description: Restrict results to orders made by a specific customer.

has_outreach.description: Restrict results to orders that have an outreach attached. For example, an email campaign or Facebook ad.

dc.description: `dc` corresponds to the data center for your account. For example, if the last part of your MailChimp API key is us6, set `dc` to `"us6"`

outputSchema.title: Orders
outputSchema.description: A collection of orders in an account.

orders.title: Orders
orders.description: An array of objects, each representing an order resource.

items.title: E-commerce Order
items.description: Information about a specific order.

id.title: Order Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the order.

customer.title: E-commerce Customer
customer.description: Information about a specific customer. Orders for existing customers should include only the `id` parameter in the `customer` object body.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing MailChimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your MailChimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#about-subscribers-and-customers).

company.title: Company
company.description: The customer's company.

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated.

financial_status.description: The order status. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-status-notifications).

fulfillment_status.description: The fulfillment status for the order. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-status-notifications).

actions.title: getEcommerceStoresIdCarts
actions.description: Get information about a store's carts.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

count.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **10**.

offset.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **0**.

dc.description: `dc` corresponds to the data center for your account. For example, if the last part of your MailChimp API key is us6, set `dc` to `"us6"`

outputSchema.title: Carts
outputSchema.description: A collection of a store's carts.

carts.title: E-commerce Store Carts
carts.description: An array of objects, each representing a cart.

items.title: E-commerce Cart
items.description: Information about a specific cart.

id.title: Cart Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the cart.

customer.title: E-commerce Customer
customer.description: Information about a specific customer. Orders for existing customers should include only the `id` parameter in the `customer` object body.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing MailChimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your MailChimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#about-subscribers-and-customers).

company.title: Company
company.description: The customer's company.

orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

actions.description: Get information about a store's promo rules.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

count.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **10**.

offset.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **0**.

outputSchema.title: Promo Rules
outputSchema.description: A collection of the store's promo rules.

promo_rules.title: Promo Rules
promo_rules.description: An array of objects, each representing promo rules defined for a store.

items.title: E-commerce Promo Rule
items.description: Information about an Ecommerce Store's specific Promo Rule

id.title: Promo Rule Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the promo rule. If Ecommerce platform does not support promo rule, use promo code id as promo rule id. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 50.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title that will show up in promotion campaign. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 100.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of a promotion restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 255.
description.example: Save BIG during our summer sale!

starts_at.title: Promo Start Time
starts_at.description: The date and time when the promotion is in effect in ISO 8601 format.

ends_at.title: End Time
ends_at.description: The date and time when the promotion ends. Must be after starts_at and in ISO 8601 format.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The amount of the promo code discount. If 'type' is 'fixed', the amount is treated as a monetary value. If 'type' is 'percentage', amount must be a decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed.

target.title: Target
target.description: The target that the discount applies to.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the promo rule is currently enabled.

created_at_foreign.title: Foreign Create Time
created_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was updated in ISO 8601 format.

outreach_id.description: Restrict results to orders with a specific `outreach_id` value.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing MailChimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your MailChimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#about-subscribers-and-customers).

company.title: Company
company.description: The customer's company.

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the customer was created.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign associated with an order.

landing_site.title: Landing Site
landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

financial_status.title: Financial Status
financial_status.description: The order status. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-status-notifications).

fulfillment_status.title: Fulfillment Status
fulfillment_status.description: The fulfillment status for the order. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-status-notifications).

currency_code.title: Currency Code

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

list_id.description: The unique id for the list.

offset.description: The number of instances to skip from the beginning of the collection. [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **0**.

items.description: Individuals who are currently or have been previously subscribed to this list, including members who have bounced or unsubscribed.

unique_email_id.description: An identifier for the address across all of MailChimp.

email_type.title: Email Type
email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').

merge_fields.title: Member Merge Var
merge_fields.description: An individual merge var and value for a member.

additionalProperties.description: This object's keys are merge tags (like FNAME). It's values are the values to be added to the merge field.

interests.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.

additionalProperties.title: Interest Value
additionalProperties.description: Keys are interest IDs, values are booleans that describe whether the list member is in that group or not.

actions.title: getSearchCampaigns

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

query.description: The search query used to filter results.

snip_start.description: To have the match highlighted with something (like a strong HTML tag), both this and `snip_end` must be passed. This parameter has a 25-character limit.

snip_end.description: To have the match highlighted with something (like a strong HTML tag), both this and `snip_start` must be passed. This parameter has a 25-character limit.

offset.description: The number of instances to skip from the beginning of the collection. [Default value](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#pagination) is **0**.

web_id.description: The ID used in the MailChimp web application. View this campaign in your MailChimp account at `https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/campaigns/show/?id={web_id}`.

content_type.description: How the campaign's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

needs_block_refresh.title: Needs Block Refresh
needs_block_refresh.description: Determines if the campaign needs its blocks refreshed by opening the web-based campaign editor.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique list id.

segment_text.title: Segment Text
segment_text.description: A description of the [segment](http://kb.mailchimp.com/segments/how-to-use-groups-and-segments?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) used for the campaign. Formatted as a string marked up with HTML.

recipient_count.title: Recipient Count
recipient_count.description: Count of the recipients on the associated list. Formatted as an integer.

settings.title: Campaign Settings
settings.description: The settings for your campaign, including subject, from name, reply-to address, and more.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

title.title: Campaign Title
title.description: The title of the campaign.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign.

use_conversation.title: Conversation
use_conversation.description: Use MailChimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The campaign's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name [merge field](http://kb.mailchimp.com/merge-tags/using/getting-started-with-merge-tags?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

folder_id.title: Folder ID
folder_id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder.

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether MailChimp [authenticated](http://kb.mailchimp.com/delivery/deliverability-research/set-up-mailchimp-authentication?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append MailChimp's [default footer](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/theres-a-gray-footer-added-to-my-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to the campaign.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

auto_tweet.title: Auto-Tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the [campaign archive](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/archives/set-up-your-campaign-archive?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page when the campaign is sent.

auto_fb_post.title: Auto Post to Facebook
auto_fb_post.description: An array of [Facebook](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/facebook/integrate-facebook-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page ids to auto-post to.

fb_comments.title: Facebook Comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The id for the template used in this campaign.

drag_and_drop.title: Drag And Drop Campaign
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the campaign uses the drag-and-drop editor.

variate_settings.title: A/B Test Options
variate_settings.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

winning_campaign_id.title: Winning Campaign ID
winning_campaign_id.description: ID of the campaign that was sent to the remaining recipients based on the winning combination.

winner_criteria.title: Winning Criteria
winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenueor you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the MailChimp web application.

wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

test_size.title: Test Size
test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

subject_lines.title: Subject Lines
subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

send_times.title: Send Times
send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.

from_names.title: From Names
from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

reply_to_addresses.title: Reply To Addresses
reply_to_addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

contents.title: Content Descriptions
contents.description: Descriptions of possible email contents. To set campaign contents, make a PUT request to /campaigns/{campaign_id}/content with the field 'variate_contents'.

combinations.title: Combinations
combinations.description: Combinations of possible variables used to build emails.

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique ID for the combination.

subject_line.title: Subject Line
subject_line.description: The index of `variate_settings.subject_lines` used.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The index of `variate_settings.from_names` used.

recipients.title: Recipients
recipients.description: The number of recipients for this combination.

tracking.title: Campaign Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for a campaign.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-open-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs). Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Click-Tale) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

salesforce.title: Salesforce CRM Tracking
salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimp's built-in [Salesforce integration](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-salesforce-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

campaign.title: Salesforce Campaign
campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.title: Salesforce Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

capsule.title: Capsule CRM Tracking
capsule.description: Capsule tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimp's built-in Capsule integration.

notes.title: Capsule Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

feed_url.title: Feed URL
feed_url.description: The URL for the RSS feed.

frequency.title: Frequency
frequency.description: The frequency of the RSS Campaign.

schedule.title: Sending Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for sending the RSS Campaign.

hour.title: Sending Hour
hour.description: The hour to send the campaign in local time. Acceptable hours are 0-23. For example, '4' would be 4am in [your account's default time zone](http://kb.mailchimp.com/accounts/account-setup/how-to-set-account-defaults?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

daily_send.title: Daily Sending Days
daily_send.description: The days of the week to send a daily RSS Campaign.

sunday.title: Sunday
sunday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Sundays.

monday.title: Monday
monday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Mondays.

tuesday.title: tuesday
tuesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Tuesdays.

wednesday.title: Monday
wednesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Wednesdays.

thursday.title: Thursday
thursday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Thursdays.

friday.title: Friday
friday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Fridays.

saturday.title: Saturday
saturday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Saturdays.

weekly_send_day.title: Weekly Sending Day
weekly_send_day.description: The day of the week to send a weekly RSS Campaign.

monthly_send_date.title: Monthly Sending Day
monthly_send_date.description: The day of the month to send a monthly RSS Campaign. Acceptable days are 0-31, where '0' is always the last day of a month. Months with fewer than the selected number of days will not have an RSS campaign sent out that day. For example, RSS Campaigns set to send on the 30th will not go out in February.

last_sent.title: Last Sent
last_sent.description: The date the campaign was last sent.

constrain_rss_img.title: Constrain RSS Images
constrain_rss_img.description: Whether to add CSS to images in the RSS feed to constrain their width in campaigns.

split_test.title: Split Test
split_test.description: The type of AB split to run.

pick_winner.title: Pick Winner
pick_winner.description: How we should evaluate a winner. Based on 'opens', 'clicks', or 'manual'.

wait_units.title: Wait Time
wait_units.description: How unit of time for measuring the winner ('hours' or 'days'). This cannot be changed after a campaign is sent.

wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: The amount of time to wait before picking a winner. This cannot be changed after a campaign is sent.

split_size.title: Split Size
split_size.description: The size of the split groups. Campaigns split based on 'schedule' are forced to have a 50/50 split. Valid split integers are between 1-50.

from_name_a.title: From Name Group A
from_name_a.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the name for Group A.

from_name_b.title: From Name Group B
from_name_b.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the name for Group B.

reply_email_a.title: Reply Email Group A
reply_email_a.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the reply-to address for Group A.

reply_email_b.title: Reply Email Group B
reply_email_b.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the reply-to address for Group B.

subject_a.title: Subject Line Group A
subject_a.description: For campaigns split on 'Subject Line', the subject line for Group A.

subject_b.title: Subject Line Group B
subject_b.description: For campaigns split on 'Subject Line', the subject line for Group B.

send_time_a.title: Send Time Group A
send_time_a.description: The send time for Group A.

send_time_b.title: Send Time Group B
send_time_b.description: The send time for Group B.

send_time_winner.title: Send Time Winner
send_time_winner.description: The send time for the winning version.

social_card.title: Campaign Social Card
social_card.description: The preview for the campaign, rendered by social networks like Facebook and Twitter. [Learn more](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/previews-and-tests/set-up-social-cards?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

image_url.title: Image URL
image_url.description: The url for the header image for the card.

description.title: Campaign Description
description.description: A short summary of the campaign to display.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the card. Typically the subject line of the campaign.

report_summary.title: Campaign Report Summary
report_summary.description: For sent campaigns, a summary of opens, clicks, and e-commerce data.

opens.title: Automation Opens
opens.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

clicks.title: Total Clicks
clicks.description: The total number of clicks for an campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

total_orders.title: Total Orders
total_orders.description: The total orders for a campaign.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total spent for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals with no deductions.

total_revenue.title: Total Revenue
total_revenue.description: The total revenue for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals minus shipping and tax totals.

actions.title: getPing
actions.description: A health check for the API that won't return any account-specific information.

dc.description: `dc` corresponds to the data center for your account. For example, if the last part of your MailChimp API key is us6, set `dc` to `"us6"`

outputSchema.title: API health status
outputSchema.description: API health status.

health_status.title: API health status
health_status.description: This will return a constant string value if the request is successful. Ex. "Everything's Chimpy!"
